Liked: We spent one night at the gueshouse on Saturday in transit. The overall impression was positive, nice green garden and swings to have some relaxation. The property is well taken care of. The rooms were nicely decorated in a charming country style. The king size bed was very comfortable. The rooms were clean. The guesthouse was full with a Bulgarian crowd who were spending their weekend (self-catering)..
Disliked: Some tips: the village is remote, so if you arrive late at night like we did (driving for 12 hours), there is absolutely no beverage or food served at the gueshouse or in the village. You would have to drive several km back to Veliko Tirnovo to have some food (even water). The young lady that is taking care of the house was nice and 'found' a cup of coffee for me the next morning. We would recommend the owners to make available some bottles of drinking water, tea, coffee for late night guests like us..
Combined comment: We spent one night at the gueshouse on Saturday in transit. The overall impression was positive, nice green garden and swings to have some relaxation. The guesthouse was full with a Bulgarian crowd who were spending their weekend (self-catering).. The host (Mr. Lazar) informed us by phone the night before that the location was in a kind of renovation and that there are teams of workers working from morning till night. He promised us a discount if we agreed to stay (we agreed being too late to look elsewhere) we did not receive any discount, and the workers were present from 8 am including Saturday and Sunday, so waking up it was mandatory then. Otherwise, the location is quite far from the areas of interest in the city. You can find better accommodation in the city and not have to drive every time and not be able to have a beer at the restaurant. I did not receive any invoices or tax receipts for the money paid. We do not recommend visiting this location.

Disliked: .‚Äú- Very friendly hosts.- The location of the guesthouse is ideal, as it is close to the Tsarevets fortress (13 mins walking distance) and close to the city center and local restaurants.- very good quality/price ratio, good amenities, the apartment is cool enough during summer days, you don‚Äôt necessarily have to turn the AC on.- many people here are complaining about the parking lots: yes, you have to climb up some narrow streets and high ramps in order to reach the guesthouse (both by car and as a pedestrian, which requires some physical effort) but the parking is free and is only 1 min away from the guesthouse which is nice! .- the furniture and the apartment itself looks nice .- very safe place, as both the entrance gate and the door of the building are locked, and you will have to close and open those door each time you leave/come back. .- as a final note, the streets are surrounded by cats :) so you have some friendly companions to pet‚Äù.
Combined comment: .‚Äú- Very friendly hosts.- The location of the guesthouse is ideal, as it is close to the Tsarevets fortress (13 mins walking distance) and close to the city center and local restaurants.- very good quality/price ratio, good amenities, the apartment is cool enough during summer days, you don‚Äôt necessarily have to turn the AC on.- many people here are complaining about the parking lots: yes, you have to climb up some narrow streets and high ramps in order to reach the guesthouse (both by car and as a pedestrian, which requires some physical effort) but the parking is free and is only 1 min away from the guesthouse which is nice! .- the furniture and the apartment itself looks nice .- very safe place, as both the entrance gate and the door of the building are locked, and you will have to close and open those door each time you leave/come back. .- as a final note, the streets are surrounded by cats :) so you have some friendly companions to pet‚Äù.

We've booked and apartment for 4 persons and we had a small kitchen with useful things for a breakfast.‚Äù.

Disliked: .‚Äú- Very friendly hosts.- The location of the guesthouse is ideal, as it is close to the Tsarevets fortress (13 mins walking distance) and close to the city center and local restaurants.- very good quality/price ratio, good amenities, the apartment is cool enough during summer days, you don‚Äôt necessarily have to turn the AC on.- many people here are complaining about the parking lots: yes, you have to climb up some narrow streets and high ramps in order to reach the guesthouse (both by car and as a pedestrian, which requires some physical effort) but the parking is free and is only 1 min away from the guesthouse which is nice! .- the furniture and the apartment itself looks nice .- very safe place, as both the entrance gate and the door of the building are locked, and you will have to close and open those door each time you leave/come back. .- as a final note, the streets are surrounded by cats :) so you have some friendly companions to pet‚Äù.

Disliked: .‚Äú- Very friendly hosts.- The location of the guesthouse is ideal, as it is close to the Tsarevets fortress (13 mins walking distance) and close to the city center and local restaurants.- very good quality/price ratio, good amenities, the apartment is cool enough during summer days, you don‚Äôt necessarily have to turn the AC on.- many people here are complaining about the parking lots: yes, you have to climb up some narrow streets and high ramps in order to reach the guesthouse (both by car and as a pedestrian, which requires some physical effort) but the parking is free and is only 1 min away from the guesthouse which is nice! .- the furniture and the apartment itself looks nice .- very safe place, as both the entrance gate and the door of the building are locked, and you will have to close and open those door each time you leave/come back. .- as a final note, the streets are surrounded by cats :) so you have some friendly companions to pet‚Äù.

Disliked: .‚Äú- Very friendly hosts.- The location of the guesthouse is ideal, as it is close to the Tsarevets fortress (13 mins walking distance) and close to the city center and local restaurants.- very good quality/price ratio, good amenities, the apartment is cool enough during summer days, you don‚Äôt necessarily have to turn the AC on.- many people here are complaining about the parking lots: yes, you have to climb up some narrow streets and high ramps in order to reach the guesthouse (both by car and as a pedestrian, which requires some physical effort) but the parking is free and is only 1 min away from the guesthouse which is nice! .- the furniture and the apartment itself looks nice .- very safe place, as both the entrance gate and the door of the building are locked, and you will have to close and open those door each time you leave/come back. .- as a final note, the streets are surrounded by cats :) so you have some friendly companions to pet‚Äù.

Liked: Discrimination in 2021!.
Disliked: Unfortunately, although in a united Europe I was surprised that the hotel staff and policy were discriminatory. Although we have been traveling the world through Booking.com for many years, on September 4, 2021 we found out that there are still people who should not be received in this great European family. I received another APARTMENT and a different room than the ones booked since July, and yet I paid the full price for the panoramic ones. The reason behind it was that I was Romanian. In a word: discrimination! Shame on them!.
Combined comment: Discrimination in 2021!. Unfortunately, although in a united Europe I was surprised that the hotel staff and policy were discriminatory. I received another APARTMENT and a different room than the ones booked since July, and yet I paid the full price for the panoramic ones. The reason behind it was that I was Romanian. In a word: discrimination! Shame on them!.

Liked: Great labyrinthine interior architecture. :) It's a hotel you can explore for tens of minutes (corridors - some even curved or sloping, elevators, surprise stairs, small hallways with sofas, all kinds of halls, garden) and you still can't be sure you've arrived everywhere or that you understand where you are. Two floors are not the same! You enter the hotel at street level and from here ... lower and lower, into the rock! It's a real challenge for mystery lovers. :) The view over the valley is very beautiful. It's clean, linen has been changed, friendly staff, pool and hot tub (and I'm pretty cold). Warm rooms, prompt service (trousers, massage, cosmetics.)
Disliked: Three things: 1. Sleeping very hard on the sofa in the living room of the apartment. It is strong and has three different portions in structure and softness and is a bit torturous. I guess it's the same furniture in all the apartments. I think it would be a minimal investment and a 10 cm mattress that would be placed on top when the sofa was stretched would solve all the problems. 2. The coffee is not too great ... 3. Very slippery tiles in the pool area and locker rooms, you have to step carefully.

Before dinner I ordered some food through Take a wai, I ate in the lobby of the hotel bar, where what you see was almost dark, they didn't turn on the light because ... I didn't understand. And the icing on the cake was when I left. I went to the reception to hand over the key and pay for a children's juice and a beer, the equivalent of 10 RON. I find that the amount was deducted from the card plus the value of the room of the other family who was going to pay them, normally. And here's a whole story, with proof of my payment on the card, with the confirmation of payment / reservation from them and so on. In the end, our friends paid the difference for their room plus what I paid for the 2nd time ... Liked: The location of the hotel and the view of the monument are great. Breakfast was well made.
Disliked: Check-in was slow and difficult, staff were slow and  seemed to be out of focus. The same things had to be repeated several times as they had sent us to the room without a key (since we asked if they would give us one). Booking has a choice of twin beds or an extra large double bed in the room, I have chosen the extra large double bed. The room was a single-framed bed with two separate mattresses, unfortunately this does not match the extra-large double bed as described. Nowhere in the Booking offer was it mentioned that they would want an additional sauna and steam bath, it is not appropriate to advertise a spa and wellness centre and to omit to mention that it will be worth additionally to what we believe is unnecessarily high prices they have set. The room was blowing and therefore had to be compensated with the air conditioning on permanently and was extremely uncomfortable. .For this money (130 leva per night) that this hotel wants, I will repeat:.- distracted non-professional staff.- Room description does not match the ad on the site (bed).- The window in the room is so high that it raises the curtain.- Sauna and steam bath must be paid on top of 130 lev per night.Our room has not been cleaned during our stay (no towels have been changed, trash has been thrown out or beds have been made)

Liked: The apartment is very clean, cozy and well arranged. It has everything useful for short or long stay in the city. Near the center, in new building, in a very quiet location, near park. Has functional kitchen with all the basic things you need to cook yourself something. The living room is also very comfortable and well organized. You can't feel lack of nothing in this place. Has extra pillows, coffee capsules, tea... Great place!.There is a big shop also near the building and a coffee shop with bakery..
Disliked: The bathroom curtain is not suitable for its purpose, when you take shower everything outside become wet and full of water. For sure it should be invented other way to organize the shower angle, because it is really uncomfortable to have bathroom full of water after every shower.....The washing machine has no dryer... It could be a problem sometime, especially in cloudy, cold or winter days for people that don't have enough clothes and are for short stay..

Liked: We spent almost a week in this apartment..The apartment is large, very modern and clean. Everything you need, you will find here..from a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher and washing machine, a big fridge with freezer, microwave and a real oven, basically you can stay here for a long period. The apartment is perfect for families, a baby cot free of charge is provided and you have a big TV in each room. The apartment was on the 5th floor.  A nice surprise was a bottle of wine and cookies for children. .The location is around 2 km from the city center, there are many supermarkets around and a large children park. We liked the location because It is very easy to get out of the city to visit the natural parks around without having  to  cross  the city center. A  good parking place was provided..The owner is very nice and always ready to help if you need or ask anything..We will certainly come back!.

Liked: Very old housing in the heart of the city. The location is great. Historic center within walking distance. The entrance to the housing is separate, but passes through a corridor littered with rubbish. A room in the spirit of a deep Soviet style. Shower and toilet are clean. Kitchen NO. Basically NO. There is a covered terrace, like a glazed balcony, lined with potted flowers and saturated with the smells of cats. NO breakfast. When asked about the kitchen and breakfast, the owner mumbled something unintelligible, making it clear that there are NO such services. In total, housing is suitable for coming and falling into bed after a long tiring road, and getting up in the morning, taking a shower and leaving.
Disliked: NO kitchen and breakfast. We had to eat in restaurants, which significantly increased the cost. The smell of cats. The owner has real estate in the very center of the city and earns by renting rooms. But do not rush to put your house in order.

The bathroom has broken glass on the window, which makes taking a shower a bad experience in colder weather.

Liked: The Guesthouse is located in the old town, in a tenement house, where you can walk, order a taxi or take a bus. There is a grocery store in the immediate vicinity, 4 minutes to the fortress. In the guesthouse itself there is also a pub with tasty food at affordable prices (I personally recommend it, we only ate there). The place itself has an original atmosphere due to the specific decor, it looks a bit like an "antique" shop where you will find various items and decorations on the walls or on the tables :) room with a similar atmosphere, two comfortable beds, TV, air conditioning and many, many items. Bathroom in the corridor with hot water, good standard. The owner is nice, after our arrival the room was not ready yet, so as a compensation we got a beer as a gift. The place is worth visiting, if only because of the unusual decor and homely atmosphere :)
Disliked: The only thing you can fault is the girls who work there and they are not very well understood, so you need to have a little patience to get along with them :)

Liked: The staff is very nice, and I'm sorry I didn't have more time to meet them. I am also very pleased with breakfast, I had breakfast twice with seasonal fruit and milk squeezed - very tasty and satisfying, and I have no reviews for the other offers. The location is good if you want to explore the historical part of the city, but it's far from everything else - a mall, hypercarkets, banks, a hospital. Public transport stops are nearby, but you will need local advice to get around. The bed was comfortable, there was hot water always, air conditioning, a terrace and it was generally very peaceful. I'd stay there again.
Disliked: There was dust on the furniture. The front door of the house is not locked.

They didn't return my messages! They didn't answer their phone once, even though I've called five or six times! I arrived at the scene tonight and no one answered! The place looked uninhabited! I don't understand why such places accept bookings when they are obviously not working !‚Äù I had to find a new property at the last minute! Booking didn't reply either! I wrote to the customer service department the next day, told them what happened and so far - I haven't had an answer for a few days now! Very foolish! Now that I've booked, I don't know what to expect when I arrive! No answer from anyone! I saw a code-locked device on the door - no one thought to send me the code if it works at all

Liked: As always the Hostel was great, i stayed here many times. Tho it's not only the facilities that makes this place stand out, it's the other guests that stay/visit, from all parts of Europe and beyond that share their experiences, there is always a friendly and welcoming atmosphere from the moment you check-in! Free parking too which a huge bonus!!!!!.

Liked: It's a nice hostel in a nice village. The shower is good, the bed is good, there are free towels, and the location is perfectly fine..
Disliked: There's a guy occasionally hanging around outside of the hostel trying to sell you a bunch of presumably worthless coins to fund the hospital stay of his parents or something like that. If that is true. Not a bad thing about this hostel by any means! But, the more you know. :).

Liked: An experience which is certainly appropriate for the historic town of Tarnovo. Situated in an old house with pine floors, the property has a rustic home-like feel and features very spacious dorm rooms. Downstairs there is a cosy common room with a decently equipped kitchen, plus a pillow seating area just outside the dorm rooms. Lockers are available but keys must be requested from reception. Toilet and shower were both quite clean and well set up..
Disliked: Bunk beds are not particularly substantial in their construction and as such can be a bit noisy when shifting around..
Combined comment: An experience which is certainly appropriate for the historic town of Tarnovo. Toilet and shower were both quite clean and well set up.. Bunk beds are not particularly substantial in their construction and as such can be a bit noisy when shifting around..

Liked: I really enjoyed my stay at Hostel Mostel in Veliko Tarnovo. The location is good, very close to the Tsarevets fortress and not too far from town. It was very clean while I was here and I always felt comfortable. Radoslav was very accommodating and communication was never an issue, even now that the reception only works limited hours. All in all I would recommend this hostel to everyone and I would definitely stay here again! I slept in both the dorm and the private room and I would say the private room is especially good value since it comes with its own bathroom..

All in all I would recommend this hostel to everyone and I would definitely stay here again! I slept in both the dorm and the private room and I would say the private room is especially good value since it comes with its own bathroom..

Disliked: Common room is a bit cold although it's spacious and cozy..

Liked: It was an excellent picturesque place to stay- right in the city centre, great host, easy check-in process (we received all necessary info via email prior to arriving in Veliko Tarnovo). We actually got a bigger room than what we chose). Very nice view from the room, private, clean bathroom, free parking right on the hostel‚Äôs street. Overall a pleasant experience, we recommend the place and we would return..
Disliked: No heating, no breakfast (but we were informed prior to our stay that due to COVID-19 regulations they‚Äôve stopped their breakfast service). When you go out of the hostel you have to ‚Äúclimb‚Äù a steep street to get to the centre, but it is to be expected in Tarnovo..

Liked: One of, perhaps the, nicest hostel I‚Äôve stayed at (& I‚Äôve been through a lot). Often the clean (sterilised) places with all the facilities are the ones lacking a soul, they strip-out the character & charm of the place. Here has the best if both worlds; it feels cozy, intimate  - but it‚Äôs spacious, it‚Äôs pristine but homely..And as to the location, the castle really is round the corner (though I‚Äôll grant you the corner is a hundred metres away and technically you have to go up some steps before you‚Äôre actually at the entrance), and if you turn left instead of right at he top of the road that‚Äôs where the town centre begins..Bars, shops & eateries abound within a short walk..And the view of the mountain from the balcony would be worth coming for itself..

The vibe of the hostel was also great, nice guests, fantastic kitchen facilities and dining area, big private room with a heater & most of all I loved that there were 2 cats on sight who are very friendly. There is also a donation box for the stray cats & dogs to which you can contribute which I think is a really nice touch..
Disliked: The Wi-Fi didn't reach my room but no big deal at all..

Liked: It is an amazing hostel! An old style house has been beautifully restored and renovated. The dorms and common area were spacious and full of light, the kitchen had a nice atmosphere as well. The location is good or bad depending what you look for - it is 3 minutes from the fortress but half an hour from the center (bus station etc). I liked my stay in Hostel Mostel and would recommend it to any visitor of Veliko Tarnovo..
Disliked: Staff could explain more about the hostel's facilities and activities (dinner, tours, events). The smoking terrace was right next to my window, so smoke was constantly drifting inside..

Disliked: I only arrived at the hostel and 15 minutes later I closed for another three days.

Liked: It is such a nice and small Hostel for getting in contact with a lot of people. I really enjoyed my stay, it is more like a big whole family especially becauce you have dinner and breakfast together. The food was also good (vegetarian)..Apart from that they will organise some really nice daytours for less money if you are a group of 4-7 persons .The stuff is really nice, can speak english fluently and will help you with everything you need for your trip.
Disliked: Totaly it was clean, but the stuff is not cleaning restrooms and showers every day so that was not that comfort..

Liked: Girl at reception during the day was absolutely lovely. Had an excellent sense of humour but was also a great cook, went above and beyond for everyone..The other people at the hostel were also very nice..Breakfast and dinner were included, everything was clean and in working order. .There are many mosquitoes but this has nothing to do with the hostel itself, simply something to be aware of when traveling to the area..Ignoring the evening guy, this is an exceptional hostel.
Disliked: The heavier male who was at reception during the evening/night was rude. Everyone hated him. He just wasn't a nice person. If someone did something wrong instead of asking nicely for the to stop, he'd come with some sarcastic and rude comment, he treated 30 years olds like children..From the way he acts, you get the feeling he hates himself, and it reflects upon every interaction you have with him..

Liked: The hostel has excellent location. The staff is very nice and helpful. Price is incredible considering the overall experience..
Disliked: Beds are not too comfortable and the served dinner is rather simple. Still no complaints from me considering the price and the location..

Liked: The price includes breakfast and dinner,both of them are so nice.and they serve the coffee for all day,also really nice..

Liked: A lot of space in the room and a nice garden.

Liked: Great stay and the best staff in Veliko Tarnovo! The girls running the facility literally did everything! They cook a free dinner for the whole hostel and prepare breakfast in the morning! They do your laundry overnight and it's clean and ready by the morning. They are super friendly and helpful. I mismanaged my checkout and missed all public transportation but the nice girl on staff was able to get me a ride with someone via a facebook group! They really go above and beyond!  Thank you so much for all the help! I can't recommend more this perfect place to stay!.
Disliked: Nothing, everything was great and I highly recommend staying here..

Liked: Amazing hostel! Delicious lentil curry dinner with bread! Great breakfast! Free coffee and tea anytime you like. Great kitchen too if you want to cook yourself! Very clean! Shower was nice and hot and pressure was great too! Staff were so kind and friendly and were happy to help with anything! Comfy common area with lots of pillows and beautiful outdoor areas too! Definitely recommend a stay here! Great value!.
Disliked: Bit of a walk from the south bus station (25minutes), so a bit of a walk if you have heavy bags but VERY close to the fortress which was great!!.

Definitely recommend a stay here! Great value!. Bit of a walk from the south bus station (25minutes), so a bit of a walk if you have heavy bags but VERY close to the fortress which was great!!.

Liked: Very nice hostel. The location is perfect! The house is very nice and the facilities good. The food was surprisingly good/enough, for it‚Äôs included. The girl who checked us in, was very friendly and hospitable..
Disliked: We were sleeping in the dorm. This was quite smelly and noisy. Of course this depends on your roommates. And we were playing a game in the common room very quiet, but according to the staff it wasn‚Äôt quiet enough..

Liked: Well, where do I start? Amazing staff, great atmosphere, nice comfy rooms, great prices, beautiful scenery.
Disliked: The only thing was that the shower was a little messed up.
Combined comment: Well, where do I start? Amazing staff, great atmosphere, nice comfy rooms, great prices, beautiful scenery. The only thing was that the shower was a little messed up.

Liked: Good clean hostal with very friendly and helpful staff. Efficient and organised. Good location in between fortress and city centre, easy to walk to both, quiet neighbourhood. Breakfast and dinner included was a bonus..
Disliked: The bed could have been more comfortable..
Combined comment: Good clean hostal with very friendly and helpful staff. Efficient and organised. Good location in between fortress and city centre, easy to walk to both, quiet neighbourhood. Breakfast and dinner included was a bonus.. The bed could have been more comfortable..

Liked: Everything....I've been living in hostels for a year, and hostel Mostel rates my highest recommendation. The staff are simply the best of hosts one could ever want, lovely to talk to, extremely helpful. They even get your laundry done for you!  They put on a free varied all you can eat breakfast....plus the only hostel I know of that supplies you a free light dinner with a free beer! The facilities are excellent. Fantastic fully stocked bar b que area which I used often. Another sunny patio out front.  Very close to main attraction, the Tsavaret fortress...which on last Thursday every month is free entry. Close by uphill walk to nearest shops, Main Street and restaurants. By fortress the green restaurant sells great food, generous portions and well priced..I loved it here I have extended my stay by a few days....and after my trip north, intend on coming back here within the next two to three months. Just the best place to relax in the quiet, listen to the bird life in the bush surrounding you, and enjoy it..!.
Disliked: Smokers should be banned from smoking on the property entirely, in my opinion....but if not....then banned from the front entrance door and porch at least!.
Combined comment: Everything....I've been living in hostels for a year, and hostel Mostel rates my highest recommendation. The staff are simply the best of hosts one could ever want, lovely to talk to, extremely helpful. They even get your laundry done for you! Close by uphill walk to nearest shops, Main Street and restaurants. By fortress the green restaurant sells great food, generous portions and well priced..I loved it here I have extended my stay by a few days....and after my trip north, intend on coming back here within the next two to three months. Just the best place to relax in the quiet, listen to the bird life in the bush surrounding you, and enjoy it..!. Smokers should be banned from smoking on the property entirely, in my opinion....but if not....then banned from the front entrance door and porch at least!.

Disliked: Nothing.

Liked: Terrific place.  Super friendly and helpful staff.  Very chill common room.  Is located on eastern side of town, so stone's throw to fortress, a little longer walk to the contemp shopping area..
Disliked: I paid to stow my car elsewhere and hiked in, as all of VT is supposed to be a restricted parking zone.  But it turned out that in off season at least, there was ample parking on hostel's street that other guests took advantage of with no ill consequences..

Liked: Beatiful hostel. One nice big house where you get very easily something like "home" feeling. Friendly stuff. Great dinner and breakfest included..

Combined comment: Great that they provide both breakfast and dinner for amazing price..

Liked: Location.
Disliked: The worst hostel experience ever. When we came to the hostel at 10 pm the temperature in the room was +5C and the heater was turned off. So you can sleep outdoors and the experience will be almost the same. It took almost 6 hours to make the temperature in the room close to normal. But in the bathroom even next morning there  was extremely cold, so it's impossible to take a shower. Probably it's great in summer , but in winter I won't recommend anyone..

Disliked: Dear Hostel Mostel!.Room 4 is a cellar in a sort of demi-basement, not a room to be offered for the tourists! It has deficitary ventilation (only a small plastic window to be opened), visible mold on the walls, the blind, opaque, window is at the street level, all the noxes enter that small window. All the trafic noise gets in the room..Except 3 beds, a small coffee table and a ventilator, no basic furniture to hang-store things. Only some sockets working..Bathroom basically equipped, clean, artificial ventilation - allmost no ventilation..The wi-fi is accessible only in a very small area, arround the stairs and reception. No wi-fi internet in the room..

Liked: Hostel was in a fairly good location, a short walk to town, nice set up and overall looked clean and tidy..
Disliked: Had an unfortunate incident in my room with a guy being extremely inappropriate, told the guy working at the front desk on night shift and his reaction was as if I was bothering him and basically said that it was a mixed dorm and that things happen.  Instead of dealing with the situation he basically did nothing, finally asking the guy to stop with the inappropriate behaviour only after I insisted he handle it and refused to go back to the room unless something was done.  Whilst the incident is the first I've ever experienced in all my time traveling and certainly not something indicative of mixed dorms, all it would have taken was for the staff to deal with it and have moved the guy out of the room.  Overall the guy working night shift seemed very uninterested in working at the hostel and was in no way helpful and also when I further told the manager working the next day, he also was not caring that this incident was very upsetting to a female solo traveller.  Overall very disappointing and staff should take more care to deal with incidents with care and consideration..

Instead of dealing with the situation he basically did nothing, finally asking the guy to stop with the inappropriate behaviour only after I insisted he handle it and refused to go back to the room unless something was done.  Whilst the incident is the first I've ever experienced in all my time traveling and certainly not something indicative of mixed dorms, all it would have taken was for the staff to deal with it and have moved the guy out of the room.  Overall the guy working night shift seemed very uninterested in working at the hostel and was in no way helpful and also when I further told the manager working the next day, he also was not caring that this incident was very upsetting to a female solo traveller.  Overall very disappointing and staff should take more care to deal with incidents with care and consideration..

It would be good if they got around to upgrading the routers to have internet in the kitchen, its more comfortable to sit there to use a laptop.

Also, there are two adorable kitties on the property to play with!.

Liked: We were a group of 5 and there was plenty of space for us all. The facilities were exceptional with all sorts of cutlery, pots and pans and essentials to cook something if needed. There was even cereals in the cupboard. Liked: Lovely courtyard, quiet location, new furniture, easy communication with the hosts.
Disliked: At first, when I booked the apartment, I didn't see any mention of the bathrooms being shared, so if there were other guests, it would cause some inconvenience. I would recommend that you mark that.
Combined comment: Lovely courtyard, quiet location, new furniture, easy communication with the hosts. At first, when I booked the apartment, I didn't see any mention of the bathrooms being shared, so if there were other guests, it would cause some inconvenience. I would recommend that you mark that.

Disliked: The house is in a good location, but there are a lot of shortcomings. On entry, you go through a flat, which is shared with other residents and has to be locked. The barren path leads to a patio. Three steps to the apartment. The key is one and everyone in the company shares it, which is extremely embarrassing. There were spider webs all over the house. There is no window in the kitchen. On Sunday before noon, there was no hot water. And some tired the night before and left in the wrong place, we left dirty. Landlord didn't meet us, didn't send us. He pointed us to a place to stay, and the key was in a mailbox. You didn't care how we were for two days. .We're disappointed.

Disliked: .‚ÄúThe host met us at the front door,helped us make our way to the apartment and showed us around. The apartment is such a good value for money. Disliked: .‚ÄúThe host was very friendly and even offered us a ride to the centre as we'd been waiting for our taxi for some 15mins or so. Disliked: .‚ÄúThe host met us at the front door,helped us make our way to the apartment and showed us around. The apartment is such a good value for money. It absolutely fits 5, even 6 people, the view from the balcony is nice and the apartment is tidy and clean and there are a lot of soap bars and shampoo, in case that you did not bring any. I like that the hostasked about our intentions for the stay and therefore recommended places to visit, good restaurants and brought delivery menus from various restaurants in case that we need them. He explained how to use the oven, tv and in general made sure that we are confortable. He provided a phone number to ring if we need something and actually responded on the phone number.‚Äù.

Disliked: .‚ÄúThe host met us at the front door,helped us make our way to the apartment and showed us around. The apartment is such a good value for money. Disliked: .‚ÄúThe host was very friendly and even offered us a ride to the centre as we'd been waiting for our taxi for some 15mins or so. Disliked: .‚ÄúThe host met us at the front door,helped us make our way to the apartment and showed us around. The apartment is such a good value for money. It absolutely fits 5, even 6 people, the view from the balcony is nice and the apartment is tidy and clean and there are a lot of soap bars and shampoo, in case that you did not bring any. I like that the hostasked about our intentions for the stay and therefore recommended places to visit, good restaurants and brought delivery menus from various restaurants in case that we need them. He explained how to use the oven, tv and in general made sure that we are confortable. He provided a phone number to ring if we need something and actually responded on the phone number.‚Äù.

Disliked: .‚ÄúThe host met us at the front door,helped us make our way to the apartment and showed us around. The apartment is such a good value for money. It absolutely fits 5, even 6 people, the view from the balcony is nice and the apartment is tidy and clean and there are a lot of soap bars and shampoo, in case that you did not bring any. I like that the hostasked about our intentions for the stay and therefore recommended places to visit, good restaurants and brought delivery menus from various restaurants in case that we need them. He explained how to use the oven, tv and in general made sure that we are confortable. He provided a phone number to ring if we need something and actually responded on the phone number.‚Äù.

Hotel: The Sunny Guest House of Veliko Turnovo
Disliked: .‚ÄúThe apartment is simply beautiful, stylishly decorated, located in the heart of the old town with amazing views of the Yantra River and Veliko Tarnovo. It was a great pleasure for us to stay here. I would like to thank the host, who was very friendly and helpful, we could feel that someone was taking care of us.‚Äù.

Liked: On our trip through Bulgaria this was the first stop. The Guest House is very quietly located on the edge of the old town, which is within walking distance. A visit to the castle should not be missing. For dinner, we found with the help of a local, the hidden little restaurant 'Rich' with very good local cuisine, from the terrace you have a nice view over the city and the river. For breakfast, you can get fresh bread and other things from a shop in the neighborhood. The guest house has free coffee and tea. .A trip to the Monastery of the Holy Transfiguration of God, which is only 5 km away, is a must. During our stay we were the only visitors there and had free access.

Liked: One of the best accommodation experience I ever had- nice place, cozy room, comfortable beds, nice and very well equipped bathroom and two important things we requested: a balcony for us (smokers :-)) having also a table with two chairs and an ashtray and a parking place. Everything made possible by our lovely guest, Paula. Every morning a nice madam with a sincere smile brought us fresh coffee- thank you, Nelly! Room cleaning service and clean towels daily, a bottle of water and glasses, coffee and tea included, kettle and TV set, A / C (no noise at all!) And, of course, wi-fi for free. Everything was amazing and our stay met our expectations. We highly recommend Petra Guest House. Thank you, Paula! If you want to feel at home in Veliko Tarnovo, choose Guesthouse Petra - good location, parking space, spacious room, balcony, bathroom with everything you need, everything functional, air conditioning, exemplary cleanliness, discreet host, welcoming and smiling , the morning coffee brought with a sincere smile on her face by Nelly. I wholeheartedly recommend this accommodation!

Liked: Location. Friendly guy but I believe the description on booking.com is embellished and exaggerated..
Disliked: I wasn‚Äôt aware I would be sharing a bathroom. Mostly on booking.com it will say room with a shared bathroom. This one did not and you really had to go into the description to see that it was a shared bathroom. And I would hardly even call it a bathroom. It was a toilet with a shower hose hooked up to the basin so you are showering close to the bin of other peoples‚Äô used toilet paper as you are not allowed to flush toilet paper. YUCK!!!.The description of the room and place was misleading. There is a roof terrace but to access it you have to walk up tiny staircase and be able to climb through a tiny door. So if you are not nimble or if you are a bigger person you might not be able to access the roof terrace..Also there are a lot of stairs and the staircase is narrow so it would be difficult if you had heavy luggage..I think a lot more of this stuff needs to be put in the description..I paid for a double room. Bed was big and comfortable but I only had one pillow. Is this because I was alone? I paid the price so it seems stingy to remove a pillow and not really what is done in the hospitality industry. I know this sounds petty, but feeling duped, I just felt like a cash cow being taken for a ride..Bedroom door is glass so when light in hall is on, can‚Äôt sleep..

Disliked: .‚ÄúDuring these times, when you may opt for an apartment rather than a hotel (to avoid contact with too many people), this apartment is probably one of your best choices in Veliko Turnovo, located near the historic centre of the town. Balcony with beautiful view over the city (though not Tsarevets, in case you're definitely interested in that), new, modern apartment, with fast Wi-Fi, TV channels from many countries, washing machine, well-equiped kitchen etc. and a complimentary bottle of wine waiting for you in the fridge. The owner provides a lot of advice for things to see and do in the town. If you are coming by car, there is a reserved parking space outside the building (n.b. in this case, better to arrive from Buzludzha street, as the ones to the right are trickier to drive upwards than this one).‚Äù.

Liked: Pretty good hotel right in the heart of Veliko Tarnovo..- Great location.- Comfortable and spacious rooms.- The paintings on the walls are for sale.- The hotel is new, hence everything is nice and new.
Disliked: There is only one drawback:.- Parking space - it is really tiny and on top of that you are being charged additional (10lv per day).To be fair to the hotel, they are aware of that issue and are building a parking near the hotel, but it will be ready in 2020..

Liked: Great location, next to the Craft Street. New hotel, spotless clean. We had a very confortable  2 bedroom apart. AC in each room. Spacious bathroom. Small fridge available (empty).  Reception staff speaking English, were kind, polite and helpful. TV in all rooms, including lobby..
Disliked: Parking near to the hotel is small, I recommend booking in advance. 10 leva/day but money well spent, not easy with parking in Veliko. .Breakfast is available for 6 leva but very basic, you can choose from 2-3 options. .Space for breakfast is very small, last day we left, other option was to wait for others to finish. They can improve the offering in the menu, for 2 leva extra they can make a better plate. .Garbage should be taken daily. When you travel with kids you have diapers and all sorts of stuff. We stayed 2 nights and nobody entered the room. This is very simple thing to do with almost no cost..The rooms were overlooking the street, some noise from the cars but fine overall..
Combined comment: Great location, next to the Craft Street. New hotel, spotless clean. We had a very confortable  2 bedroom apart. AC in each room. Spacious bathroom. Small fridge available (empty).  Reception staff speaking English, were kind, polite and helpful. TV in all rooms, including lobby.. Parking near to the hotel is small, I recommend booking in advance. 10 leva/day but money well spent, not easy with parking in Veliko. .Breakfast is available for 6 leva but very basic, you can choose from 2-3 options. .Space for breakfast is very small, last day we left, other option was to wait for others to finish. They can improve the offering in the menu, for 2 leva extra they can make a better plate. .Garbage should be taken daily. When you travel with kids you have diapers and all sorts of stuff. We stayed 2 nights and nobody entered the room. This is very simple thing to do with almost no cost..The rooms were overlooking the street, some noise from the cars but fine overall..

Liked: Hotel Arte is a contemporary and stylish yet welcoming and cosy place located bang in the middle of town. I can only describe it as an impeccable artwork. Staff is friendly and helpful, cleanliness is immaculate, rooms are comfy and well designed. In real life the hotel far exceeds expectations and I can't recommend it enough.Value for money and private feel about it, great service and top location make it a true hidden gem, that enhanced our experience of exploring our enchanting Old Capital of Bulgaria, Veliko Turnovo!  I'll definitely come back. Thank you for a great stay!.
Disliked: No faults!Coming from a 5 star boutique Hotel employee in Central London, that must count for something üòâ.
Combined comment: Hotel Arte is a contemporary and stylish yet welcoming and cosy place located bang in the middle of town. I can only describe it as an impeccable artwork. Staff is friendly and helpful, cleanliness is immaculate, rooms are comfy and well designed. In real life the hotel far exceeds expectations and I can't recommend it enough.Value for money and private feel about it, great service and top location make it a true hidden gem, that enhanced our experience of exploring our enchanting Old Capital of Bulgaria, Veliko Turnovo!  I'll definitely come back. Thank you for a great stay!. No faults!Coming from a 5 star boutique Hotel employee in Central London, that must count for something üòâ.

Liked: The hotel is located on the Crafts street (the most beautiful street in Veliko), everything was very modern and clean. A limited (but handy) parking place is available (only 5 spots, with prior reservation) on which we paid 10 levas per night. Otherwise, it is very difficult to find an available place in the city. The room was very spacious, modern and clean, with very, very, good beds!!! The panoramic terrace is lovely (you can find it at the last floor). The staff was really friendly. We really enjoyed our stay!.

Liked: The location is very good although not all rooms have large windows, balcony or view. Everything is new and clean. I appreciated the roof terrace.
Disliked: The bathroom does not have a shower or window as shown in the pictures. We requested another room but we were told that only the bathroom of the apartment has a shower or window. A big inconvenience because the bathroom is quite small and inevitably the whole floor is splashed. The hotel car park is for 4-5 cars. I made a reservation in advance and paid 10 lei / night in advance upon arrival, also receiving assurances that there are enough places for guests staying, the hotel having only 7 rooms. On Saturday night, when I returned after a short drive, I found all the seats occupied. The person at the reception noticed that a car had taken up 2 seats but did nothing to solve the problem and recommended that we go to a public car park. I found a paid parking lot at approx. 1.5km. Very unpleasant, especially since in the meantime it was already dark and I had to walk back to the hotel. Plus another walk the next day to retrieve the car. It should be mentioned that the next day the gentleman at the reception paid the public parking fee of 13 leva, apologizing for the inconvenience. I understand that a hotel parking lot is being built somewhere nearby that will be ready next year.

Disliked: .‚ÄúI loved the comfort and the design of the apartament. It was the best location we could choose for our staying.‚Äù.

Disliked: .‚ÄúThe apartament exceeded my expectation. It looks like it wasn't meant to be used for tourism, but someone really lived here. The rooms are very big, everything was sparkly clean. The kitchen is very well equipped, you could easily cook serious stuff if you're up to it (but the great food you can find in the town center must be tried!). .All the electronics are high quality brands and this makes you feel very comfortable. It's like you have a new house, in Bulgaria :).Comfortable bed in the bedroom, one can also sleep in the living room, on the sofa. .The city center is close enough, you can reach it in about 15 min by walking. There's a park nearby and some restaurants, also some mini markets. It's also easy to find when coming from outside Veliko. .Overall, it was a very pleasant stay, I will definitely come back to Astoria apartament for my next vacation in Bulgaria.‚Äù.

It's also easy to find when coming from outside Veliko. .Overall, it was a very pleasant stay, I will definitely come back to Astoria apartament for my next vacation in Bulgaria.‚Äù.

Disliked: .‚ÄúThe well-maintained and comfortable apartment has many advantages. We enjoyed the comfortable sitting room with large smart TV and a bottle of wine waiting for us! Since all restaurants were closed due to COVID-19, we made good use of the well-equipped kitchen (large fridge, toaster, range, oven, kettle, plenty of cooking tools and seasonings). The bathroom has a shower closet, and a washer and dryer! The large bed was comfortable. Big spacious closet. Location was ok, better if you have a car. A supermarket is 10 minutes away on foot, and the city center attractions are easy to get to by car.  Communication was good.  Very nice, comfortable, and homey. Recommended!‚Äù.

Disliked: .‚ÄúThe apartament exceeded my expectation. It looks like it wasn't meant to be used for tourism, but someone really lived here. The rooms are very big, everything was sparkly clean. The kitchen is very well equipped, you could easily cook serious stuff if you're up to it (but the great food you can find in the town center must be tried!). .All the electronics are high quality brands and this makes you feel very comfortable. It's like you have a new house, in Bulgaria :).Comfortable bed in the bedroom, one can also sleep in the living room, on the sofa. .The city center is close enough, you can reach it in about 15 min by walking. There's a park nearby and some restaurants, also some mini markets. It's also easy to find when coming from outside Veliko. .Overall, it was a very pleasant stay, I will definitely come back to Astoria apartament for my next vacation in Bulgaria.‚Äù.

Disliked: .‚ÄúThe apartament exceeded my expectation. It looks like it wasn't meant to be used for tourism, but someone really lived here. The rooms are very big, everything was sparkly clean. The kitchen is very well equipped, you could easily cook serious stuff if you're up to it (but the great food you can find in the town center must be tried!). .All the electronics are high quality brands and this makes you feel very comfortable. It's like you have a new house, in Bulgaria :).Comfortable bed in the bedroom, one can also sleep in the living room, on the sofa. .The city center is close enough, you can reach it in about 15 min by walking. There's a park nearby and some restaurants, also some mini markets. It's also easy to find when coming from outside Veliko. .Overall, it was a very pleasant stay, I will definitely come back to Astoria apartament for my next vacation in Bulgaria.‚Äù.

Disliked: .‚ÄúThe well-maintained and comfortable apartment has many advantages. We enjoyed the comfortable sitting room with large smart TV and a bottle of wine waiting for us! The bathroom has a shower closet, and a washer and dryer! The large bed was comfortable. Big spacious closet. Location was ok, better if you have a car. A supermarket is 10 minutes away on foot, and the city center attractions are easy to get to by car.  Communication was good.  Very nice, comfortable, and homey. Recommended!‚Äù.

Liked: Great rooms, very clean and spacious, with air conditioning, a great kitchen with everything, including free coffee from a Saeco espresso machine and a very big flat screen TV, free parking in front of the building. The hotel has 7 or 8 rooms, all very nice, and is located very close to city center and main attractions (maximum 5 minutes walk to main street). The hosts are a very nice young family, speaking good English, they gave us a city map and recommended best sights to see and great restaurants in the area. We had a very pleasant stay at Gile..
Disliked: Main dissadvantage is that near the hotel there are two abandoned buildings, so first impression is not great. Also, in front of the hotel there is a hospital. Good thing is that the hospital is not an emergency, so no lousy ambulances, and also the area is very quiet, without many people in the street. First impression changes a lot when you get inside, because the interior of the hotel is excellent. We initially booked one night on the way to Greece, but after staying here we also booked this hotel for return trip..

Liked: The host is very nice, speaking excellent English, explained and showed us everything..All the guest house, and in particular our rooms were very clean..The rooms are spacious, comfortable beds, private bathroom with toilet in our rooms, and public WC in the corridor..Air conditioning and air refreshing in the rooms..The shared kitchen is also very clean, fully equipped - microwave, kettle, toaster, coffee machine, two refrigerators, two big dining tables and some sofas with low table for more comfortable sitting..The location is very near the centre, walking distance, and the host has touristic map, with all the attractions..
Disliked: This is hostel with shared kitchen, so the meals are not so private..In the evening there was some noise in the kitchen, but when the guys realised they are not alone in the guest house, they closed the door, and eventually in the room there was no noise at all..

Liked: We are very pleased to stay at this guest house. I have travelled around often, in many countries and not easy to give the maximum point but Gille guesthouse deserves a 10/10..Locatiion: next to the center so very quiet, but still close to everything, 5 min walking to main street and 10 min to center. Parking is right there..The guest house: I think it is nicer than pics, very clean, spotless inside the room, bathroom and in public area, beddings are new and clean, well decored. The guest house has a kitchen for guests to use and it is fully equipped to cook a meal or breakfast. The owner even put oil, salt, seasons, sugar....for the guests. Morden and good coffee machine with coffee and tea ready for the guests too. We stayed in a twin room and a triple room but there are other rooms of all size for 1 - 6 people, all well equipped..Communication is great, both the husband and wife speak English, and very helpful.Highly recommended. And I definitely will come back and stay if have a chance.

Liked: Hotel Gile is a real gem!  The hosts, Emil & Lily, and their young son, were amazing - so friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble.  Even though we arrived quite late Emil welcomed us with a smile, he gave us a city map and pointed out all the main places to see and gave us suggestions of where to eat.  The location is brilliant - close enough to walk to all the main sights but far enough away to be quiet at night.  There are 2 flights of steps at the side of the hotel and 10 minutes walk to the centre.  There are several restaurants just a few minutes‚Äô walk to the main street and a minimarket (open 0600-2100) at the bottom of the steps.  It was very easy to find - as other reviews have said, google maps is wrong, but as long as you get to the intersection of Buzludzha, Hristo Karaminkov and Zielonka streets, and follow the brown signs all the way through the hospital grounds you can‚Äôt go wrong (the hotel is situated in the grounds of the hospital).  There is plenty of free parking around the building (a bonus in Veliko Tarnovo!) and it is ok to leave the car during the day.  The accommodation itself is wonderful.  It looked like it had all been recently renovated and it was spotlessly clean.    There was a very big shared kitchen/dining room for the use of all guests.  It had comfy seating and 2 tables and chairs.  The kitchen was fully equipped with oven, hob, microwave, kettle, coffee machine, 2 fridge/freezers and cupboards full of utensils and crockery.  There were even a few essentials like tea, coffee, sugar, oil, salt & pepper etc.  Our room was huge with windows on three sides, with a comfortable bed and seating area, a really pleasant place to relax.  The wifi was good and there was plenty of storage and sockets, including next to the bed.  There is no fridge or kettle in the bedroom but that is OK as you can use the shared kitchen.  The bathroom was a good size and there was plenty of hot water for the shower..
Disliked: Nothing.  Wish we could have been here longer than 2 nights!.
Combined comment: Hotel Gile is a real gem!  The hosts, Emil & Lily, and their young son, were amazing - so friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble.  Even though we arrived quite late Emil welcomed us with a smile, he gave us a city map and pointed out all the main places to see and gave us suggestions of where to eat.  The location is brilliant - close enough to walk to all the main sights but far enough away to be quiet at night.  There are 2 flights of steps at the side of the hotel and 10 minutes walk to the centre.  There are several restaurants just a few minutes‚Äô walk to the main street and a minimarket (open 0600-2100) at the bottom of the steps.  It was very easy to find - as other reviews have said, google maps is wrong, but as long as you get to the intersection of Buzludzha, Hristo Karaminkov and Zielonka streets, and follow the brown signs all the way through the hospital grounds you can‚Äôt go wrong (the hotel is situated in the grounds of the hospital).  There is plenty of free parking around the building (a bonus in Veliko Tarnovo!) and it is ok to leave the car during the day.  The accommodation itself is wonderful.  It looked like it had all been recently renovated and it was spotlessly clean.    There was a very big shared kitchen/dining room for the use of all guests.  It had comfy seating and 2 tables and chairs.  The kitchen was fully equipped with oven, hob, microwave, kettle, coffee machine, 2 fridge/freezers and cupboards full of utensils and crockery.  There were even a few essentials like tea, coffee, sugar, oil, salt & pepper etc.  Our room was huge with windows on three sides, with a comfortable bed and seating area, a really pleasant place to relax.  The wifi was good and there was plenty of storage and sockets, including next to the bed.  There is no fridge or kettle in the bedroom but that is OK as you can use the shared kitchen.  The bathroom was a good size and there was plenty of hot water for the shower.. Nothing.  Wish we could have been here longer than 2 nights!.

Liked: I booked a room for one night on my way back from Greece. We were a little late for the announced time, but the owner, a very nice gentleman, called me and then waited for us. The location was easy to find with Waze, parking is ok. The room I stayed in was a large one, a double bed, two single beds and a sofa. Air conditioning (Gree), tv, Wi-fi, clean bathroom, hot water. Everything shines with cleanliness. Throughout the boarding house there are paintings on the walls made by the owner's wife, if I understood correctly, very beautiful. The kitchen, common, fully equipped for a breakfast, with 2 refrigerators and a few tables, TV, etc. In the morning I served coffee at the espresso machine, from the house. The whole pension was very clean, everything is tastefully arranged. The owner asked us if we wanted to leave the car in the restaurant area, about 300 meters from the location. It was as if he had read our thoughts and dropped us off at the Shtastliveca restaurant, where he suggested we ask for a meal on the terrace, which we did. We left early in the morning and left the keys at the front desk, as we were told. We will stop at this guesthouse whenever we pass through the resort. Thanks to the owners for their involvement!
Disliked: There are no negative aspects.

Liked: Location is amazing, close to all major sightseeing places. Fortress is 4 Min away, center is 5 min away, Samovodska charshiya is 3 min away. Really clean. Mosquito nets on the windows. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. The view from the balcony is astonishing. For the price we paid, we got really good accomodation and all basic needs are covered. We would definitely go back there again..
Disliked: There was a bathtub in the bathroom, but no plug for it, which makes no sense of having a tub in the first place. For some reason the hot water was disappearing when taking a shower, so you end up having freezing cold shower. No electricity sockets next to the bed, so making charging devices little bit hard. The linen was too short, when you're turning you end up sleeping on the mattres. No English speaking staff..

Liked: It's really a really nice little hotel, where everything speaks both of the hotel of the past but also the response to today's expectations in terms of comfort. Everything is neat, the decoration, not outdated, but old. The building features, floors, walls and ceilings, stairs are renovated and maintained. Everything comes from a clever choice. The room is spacious with a good work desk. The bedding is excellent, the bathroom is spacious with this typical Bulgarian layout to join toilet and shower without separation. Wifi excellent and above all, very high quality welcome from the hostess, smiling, informative, ready to make the effort to try to understand your naive and hesitant Bulgarian and to speak perfect English. The breakfast is also a nice surprise: it is not rich as expected from the German and Scandinavian countries auctions but it is "smart" and "aesthetic". Beautiful little yogurt and magical drink, sweet, fragrant...The hotel is located in the old historic district, with its houses, alleys, churches, museums nestled on the slopes. It is close to the famous fortress, in the same streets as many small shops certainly tourist but rich of a thousand and a beautiful and good things at the price most of the time very reasonable. The city center is not far away, some supreme values of catering are nearby, just avoid the pizzeria below, perfectly unpleasant, for 2 euros, a taxi will take you there if you are willing to do more international shopping. The price is lower than average for what we have experienced in Bulgaria for comparable quality. Maybe this is related to the current situation. Probably the time to go.

Liked: Located on the river in the historic part of town.  The area has lovely architecture and our room had views across the river to the Asenevtsi Monument and the mountains, and of the parts of town climbing the slope around the bend of the river.  Quiet at night.  Convenient to walk to the Fortress and the touristy part of town.  There‚Äôs a staircase across the road, just to the right, which takes you up to the road to then go right toward the Fortress, left to the newer part of town with lots of restaurants and to explore the historic area higher up.  Room was big and bed was firm but comfortable.  Bathroom was huge - the usual Bulgarian style with no shower cubicle or curtain so the whole room is wet after a shower, but it drains and dries fairly quickly.  Fairly new renovation so all furniture, tiling etc is in good condition..
Disliked: No great complaints.  We opted to pay ‚Ç¨1 per person extra for breakfast and, really, ‚Äòyou get what you pay for‚Äô.  First morning, for each of us, was a glass of ayran, three slices of supermarket brand sliced white toast with one butter sachet, one jam sachet and some white cheese.  Second morning was a glass of ayran and four thick slices of a sweet bun.  No coffee!  .Also, be aware this is not really a hotel, it‚Äôs rooms for rent.  There is no reception and no staff on site.  When you arrive the building is locked and you will have to phone the number on the door for someone to come and let you in and open your room.  That‚Äôs ok but maybe they could do what a lot of similar places do - advise of this when you book and invite you to advise an arrival time so someone is there to meet you.  There‚Äôs no shelter, so would be rather miserable if you arrived in the rain..
Combined comment: Located on the river in the historic part of town. First morning, for each of us, was a glass of ayran, three slices of supermarket brand sliced white toast with one butter sachet, one jam sachet and some white cheese.  Second morning was a glass of ayran and four thick slices of a sweet bun.  No coffee!  .Also, be aware this is not really a hotel, it‚Äôs rooms for rent.  There is no reception and no staff on site.  When you arrive the building is locked and you will have to phone the number on the door for someone to come and let you in and open your room. There‚Äôs no shelter, so would be rather miserable if you arrived in the rain..

Liked: Excellent location. Terrific spot to enjoy the beautiful old town. Amazing views. Steps just across and to the right lead up to the main road for easy access to restaurants and shops. Parking was tricky but nearby..
Disliked: The bed was quite firm and the linens sparse. The bathroom doesn't drain well after a shower so bring your shower flip flops or get  used to the wet floor. There is no front desk so make sure you have the number and a working phone! You'll need to call to have someone come let you in.  If you like your creature comforts this won't be the place for you..

Disliked: 1) I did like the management or, better to say - the absence of management. .2) Despite the description, promising balcony and private bath and toilet that was truth only for one of the rooms - for the "double room with balcony". The other room technically had a balcony - 60cm width, 120cm height and 5cm depth. Technically this room had also a bathroom and toilet, but outside of the room. I have to admit that this room was slightly cheaper but the misleading description was confusing, because we were two families and one room seems better..3) On the other hand the other room had some unmentioned extra's - ants everywhere.  .4) Only two (bath) waterproof towels were provided - refusing to absorb water..5) The breakfast is another surprise. The lonely stuff person said that it could be served not earlier than 10 o'clock. The breakfast would be served in the rooms - there was no other eating facilities. We decided to skip breakfast served by this person and in the offered time slot, despite we already paid for it..6) I suppose that breakfast in the room might be the reason for ants invasion.

Liked: The view from the room..
Disliked: Most things. The location is hard to get to on a narrow cobblestoned street. The building was all locked up when we arrived about 4pm. The phone numbers did not seem to work. Eventually we asked a local who had been looking on, and he rang someone - he obviously knew who to contact - and eventually some 45 minutes after arriving we were let in. Only to discover that our bathroom was across a corridor that people in the next room had to use to get to their room!! At least they had an ensuite.... So no privacy there. Nothing to stop water from the shower soaking the toilet and everything else when showering either. Our friends on the floor below us had exactly the same situation. The breakfast was lousy. And the host who let us in spoke no English, so communication was quite difficult. Consequently, we only stayed the one night, instead of the two we originally booked..

We did not even have time to ask any questions, for example, about breakfast. In the description of one of the rooms, it was indicated that it had a balcony, but what was there could not be called a balcony: a narrow platform no more than half a meter wide. In addition, it turned out that in the same room (double with two single beds) there is no bathroom. The bathroom was on the floor, which was not mentioned in the description. We wanted to leave the bags at the hotel for a few hours, but we were told that this was not possible, since none of the staff would be there.

Liked: This is a gem in the town . Everything we needed for our stay was provided. Excellent WiFi, powerful air conditioner and immaculate service. The room was  beautifully arranged and the bathroom sparkling clean. There were snacks on the table and drinks in the fridge. The communication with the host was smooth and they made us feel welcomed. The location of the place was perfect and within walking distance for all major historic places and museums. We felt the old town spirit in the modern comfort. We would love to  be back again !.
Disliked: Nothing.

The bathroom didn't have a proper shower or bath tub so there was a lot of water on the floor.

Liked: All in all its a great value for money, we came from 4* in Sofia and honestly expected much less from the place, so we were pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean, very nicely decorated, exactly like on the pictures. The radiator was fantastic for these rainy days, we were super comfortable and could quickly dry wet clothes and shoes. Dogs stayed free of charge and the owner was always available for anything, including help with parking. Even though you are in the city, it was very quiet and relaxing at night. Highly recommended for exploring the old tarnovo !.
Disliked: Access with a car is a headache, we underestimated old tarnovo streets. And for the parking, it was difficult to find a place, as there are so many restaurants around - it was full in the evening, unless you come really late. The tv in the room is mounted on the wall just between bed and sofa, so you cant properly see from both sides its like on the angle. It would be useful if we could turn it left or right..
Combined comment: All in all its a great value for money, we came from 4* in Sofia and honestly expected much less from the place, so we were pleasantly surprised. Dogs stayed free of charge and the owner was always available for anything, including help with parking. Even though you are in the city, it was very quiet and relaxing at night. Highly recommended for exploring the old tarnovo !. Access with a car is a headache, we underestimated old tarnovo streets. And for the parking, it was difficult to find a place, as there are so many restaurants around - it was full in the evening, unless you come really late. The tv in the room is mounted on the wall just between bed and sofa, so you cant properly see from both sides its like on the angle. It would be useful if we could turn it left or right..

Parking in the city (at least in its historical part) is not easy at all. The apartments are located very picturesquely, there is enough space, but no frills. The refrigerator was found only in one of the two rooms, but it was enough for us. The Internet works, the TV shows a bunch of channels (however, we did not come here for TV). Minibar for extra money. Within walking distance there is something to see and where to eat. More than enough for one night. But we must return here. Because of the weather, we didn't really see anything.

Liked: Great location. Those who have been to Veliko Tarnovo will understand me. The apartments are located in the city center, almost at the foot of the mountain, you do not need to climb up every time. The house is outwardly very old (feeling that it is 200 years old), but for me this is a plus, I love such objects. Despite the age of the building, the apartments are in good repair. The owner took care of the comfortable accommodation of guests, provided the necessary minimum set (coffee, hot chocolate, tea, sugar, etc.). Excellent value for money, definitely recommend!

The owner took care of the comfortable accommodation of guests, provided the necessary minimum set (coffee, hot chocolate, tea, sugar, etc.). Excellent value for money, definitely recommend!

Liked: Location is nice. Receptionist lady was nice..
